title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Imanol Rios-Franco and Brandon Baez sentenced for stealing and depositing checks fraudulently from USPS collection boxes.
Rios-Franco received a 35-month prison sentence, Baez two years; both ordered to pay restitution totaling $22,813.
Defendants and co-conspirators used chemicals to wash checks and fraudulently deposited them into controlled accounts.

title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Marcelo Gomes da Silva, detained by ICE in 2025, invited to State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Gomes, a Brazilian national, was detained as a collateral arrest while on his way to volleyball practice.
Gomes' detention sparked community protests and highlighted issues in the U.S. immigration system.

title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a center-ice goal in Team USA's win over Denmark, citing visibility issues.
Swayman humorously addressed a theory about the goal, joking about his colorblindness negating any board color effects.
With two other goalies on the team, this match may be Swayman's only Olympic start this year.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum's return from an Achilles injury is anticipated to impact the Celtics' performance in the upcoming NBA playoffs.
Kevin Durant expects Tatum to perform at an All-Star level upon his return, drawing from his own Achilles recovery experience.
Carmelo Anthony believes Tatum's reintroduction will make the Celtics more formidable, allowing continued leadership from Jaylen Brown.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The New England Patriots have approximately $41 million in cap space for the upcoming offseason.
Colts wide receiver Alec Pierce is a potential target for the Patriots, offering big-play ability and young talent.
Ravens tight end Isaiah Likely could fill an impending need for the Patriots at the tight end position.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN becomes MLB's new streaming partner, offering MLB.TV as an add-on for ESPN Unlimited subscribers for $134.99 per season.
Non-ESPN Unlimited subscribers can buy MLB.TV for $149.99, including a free month of ESPN Unlimited, that renews at $29.99/month.
Existing MLB.TV subscribers will be auto-renewed, allowing streaming via the MLB or ESPN apps after linking subscriptions.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Celtics' G League team, stirring speculation about his return this season.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. reported Tatum looked like himself in practice, expressing excitement for his potential return.
Despite the practice, Tatum and Celtics management emphasize no fixed timetable for his return from last year's Achilles tear.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranks as the most educated state in the U.S. according to a 2026 WalletHub study.
The study highlights Massachusetts's high levels of higher education attainment and strong public school performance.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Auction for the rare Honus Wagner baseball card concludes on February 21, with a current bid of $3.9 million.
The T206 Wagner card, kept by Massachusetts-connected Bernstein family for 116 years, is ungraded and previously undiscovered.
The card is part of a Goldin auction, featured in Netflix's 'King of Collectibles', linked to Ken Goldin's Boston connections.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will make his Olympic debut for Team USA against Denmark on Saturday.
Swayman has a 22-12-3 record with a 2.92 GAA and .903 save percentage this season.
Swayman joins Bruins teammate Charlie McAvoy on Team USA's roster at the 2026 Winter Olympics.
